page.title: 06LIFESTYLE IN OLD HACKFORD
page.content: We interviewed Cissy Buck who is 80 years old and has lived in Hackford for 75 years. She lives in a house,built in 1866, that used to be a shop until about 3 months ago. Cissy's family had owned the shop for 80 years. In the past there was no electricity and they obtained water from a well in her garden. The roads were narrow and made of stone and earth. The first person to own a car was Mr. Watling. Work was associated with agriculture, such as horsemen and cowmen. There was also a blacksmith. She attended Wicklewood School which had strict teachers, and left at 14 years of age. There were two publichouses in the village called King's Head and Red Lion. A bomb dropped near the church.War time evacuees left after the war.
